Executive Summary

    

(Peco Foods) processes (chicken) at our facility located in (Pocahontas, AR). We have a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner. 



Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation. 



A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Peco Foods, Pocahontas, AR, Facility



We take many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency response procedures that enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets. The facility maintains an ongoing emergency response program that prepares for safe evacuation and timely response by trained personnel. The (Refrigeration Superintendent) is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs. 



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled 

Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at this facility. Peco Foods processes and freezes chicken products for global distribution. Approximately 80,320 pounds of anhydrous ammonia is contained within the refrigeration system on the site at Peco Foods - Pocahontas, AR. A Risk Management Plan has been developed as required and is maintained in order to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia f

rom the system



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program 

Peco Foods - Pocahontas, AR has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements: 

?    Employee Participation Program

?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training Program

?    Contractor Safety Program

?    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

?    Mechanical Integrity Program

?    Hot Work Permit Procedures

?    Management of Change Procedures

?    Incident Investigation Procedures

?    Compliance Audit Procedures 



D. Five-Year Accident History 

This is a new facility, therefore no ammonia-related accidents have occurred at the facility over the past five years that resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences. 



E. Description of the Emergency Response Program 



Peco Foods, Pocahontas, AR maintains an ongoing emergency response program in order to efficiently notify and evacuate employees, notify potential critical receptors in the community and state and local emergency response agencies by dialing "911". The program includes initial and annual training for employees who respond to release or potential releases. The program includes written procedures for first aid and emergency medical treatment to treat human exposures; procedures for using emergency response equipment and procedures to review and update the plan and ensure that employees are informed of changes. The facility emergency response plan is coordinated with the local fire department annually as required by the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act. 



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

We have identified the following potential changes to improve the safety of our ammonia refrigeration system. 



(Possible Changes to Improve Safety)



- Annual coordination of the emergency re

sponse plan with the Fire Department and HAZMAT team.

- Annual Hazardous Material Technician and Incident Commander training. 

- Improved PSM program elements on an ongoing basis.

- Planned hiring of additional refrigeration operators

- Any refrigeration operators being hired to operate the system, will be Refrigeration Operator 1 certified

- Any refrigeration operators hired that are not currently Operator 1 certified, will receive Refrigeration Operator Level 1 certification before being allowed to operate system
